common.title: BÜRN Task Force
common.subtitle: Friendly 50v50 invasion scrims with real structure.
common.description: Drop into an organized match without sweatshop vibes.
common.footer: © 2025 BÜRN Task Force. Good games, good comms.

hero.title: BÜRN — organized chaos for squads who enjoy good games
hero.description: We host invasion lobbies with fast intel, fair play and jokes that survive both languages. Expect clean pushes, patient anchors and zero ego wars.

highlights.title: Why teams enjoy running into us
highlights.description: A short brief of the tools we bring to every scrim. It stays respectful, yet annoyingly effective.

discipline.label: Comms
discipline.title: Discipline without the drill
discipline.description: Clear calls built on habits, not yelling. Average reaction time is under a second while jokes still fly.

adapt.label: Gameplay
adapt.title: Lineups that flex in minutes
adapt.description: Swapping to double supports or triple engineers doesn't require a team meeting. We iterate mid-match.

shield.label: Defense
shield.title: Chill but stubborn holds
shield.description: Utility walls plus calm anchors equals checkpoints that refuse to fall. Math and trust over brute force.

team.title: People who keep the lobby friendly
team.description: Each operator owns a specialty: tempo, scouting, flank chaos, or morale control. Together it feels like a LAN night.

sin.name: Sex Instructor NATO
sin.bio: Sets the tempo, flips from full-send to careful sweep in a sentence and keeps both teams laughing.

thirteen.name: 13th
thirteen.bio: Lives in voice chat, patches up lost comms and sprinkles sarcasm between map reads.

satana.name: Satana v Triko
satana.bio: Finds walls on any map, detonates economy plays and somehow appears behind your back with a smile.

metr.name: Metr Pihalych
metr.bio: Builds unbreakable holds, tracks cooldown cycles and keeps everyone alive through sheer willpower.

events.title: Upcoming operations
events.description: Matches, custom lobbies and joint trainings. Calendar stays open so opponents can sync with us.
events.emptyDescription: We publish confirmed matches as soon as both teams lock in. Ping us on Discord for priority updates.
events.demoNotice: Demo schedule is shown because the Google Calendar key is missing or inaccessible.
events.registrationDescription: Join the event and become part of the match!

intel.title: Operations briefing
intel.description: Quick pulses about scrim results, training focus and community health. Updated after every play session.

ops.title: Win streak
ops.detail: Official invasion lobbies cleared without losses. Most teams bow out before wave three.

scrim.title: Practice nights
scrim.detail: Every Wednesday is a friendly custom with partner clans. Perfect for testing anti-meta ideas.

recruits.title: New faces
recruits.detail: Workshop for new players is live. We take people who hop on comms fast and enjoy feedback.

support.title: Media & vibes
support.detail: Twitch is alive, highlights go to TikTok. We want teams to feel the mood before joining.

contact.title: Talk to the HQ
contact.description: Three shortcuts that reach the officers faster than smoke signals.
contact.regionValue: Europe friendly, open to NA late nights

links.title: Where to watch BÜRN
links.description: Streams, VODs and a very alive chat. Pick your platform.

schedule.title: How we queue custom battles
schedule.description: We keep one primary format, a ready backup, and a transparent prime-time window so opponents instantly see whether we match their roster.

primary.label: Primary format
primary.title: Invasion 50v50
primary.description: Two platoons, synchronized drops, vehicle slots negotiated ahead of time. We handle server setup and admin the lobby.

alt.label: Alt modes
alt.title: Territory, RAAS, Skirmish
alt.description: If opponents want variety, we rotate through territory control, RAAS mixes, or smaller skirmish nights for new squads.

support.label: Logistics
support.title: Briefing + debrief
support.description: Shared Google Sheet with factions, FOB plans, and casters if needed. After the match we send timestamps and notes.

rules.label: Fair play
rules.title: Friendly rulebook
rules.description: Spawn locking, glitch bans, admin flow — everything condensed on the rules page so there are zero surprises.

hero.title: Rules that keep Squad invasion scrims fun and fair
hero.description: One page that explains how to book a lobby, what we expect from each side, and how to reach us if something changes mid-match.
hero.note: Need a custom clause (mods, observers, different size)? Ping us—we adapt quickly.

brief.title: Briefing & booking
brief.description: Share roster size, preferred mode, and two potential time slots. We reply with calendar invite and spreadsheet.

setup.title: Server setup
setup.description: We host or co-host. Admin rights get mirrored, password shared 15 minutes prior to match, and spectators assigned.

play.title: Play & adjust
play.description: Two rounds by default. Tactical pauses allowed for DCs; vehicle swaps locked once live.

followup.title: Follow-up
followup.description: After the lobby we send VOD, timestamps, and quick notes so both squads can iterate.

requirements.title: What we ask from every opponent

comms.title: Voice discipline
comms.description: At least one English- or Russian-speaking liaison on comms to keep pauses and restarts smooth.

roster.title: Stable roster
roster.description: Confirm final lineup 2 hours before start so we can balance roles and vehicles.

fair.title: Fair-play mindset
fair.description: No exploits, no griefing spawns, respect pauses. Admin calls are final.

broadcast.title: Streaming notice
broadcast.description: We often stream or record. Let us know if someone in your roster should be hidden.

calendar.question: How fast do you confirm a slot?
calendar.answer: Usually within 12 hours. If it’s urgent, poke us in Discord and we’ll reshuffle practice nights.

modes.question: Can we change mode on the same day?
modes.answer: Yes if both teams agree at least 30 minutes before start. Otherwise we stick to the original format.

observers.question: Do you allow observers or casters?
observers.answer: Sure. We provide separate roles and slots, just let us know in advance so the server is configured.

gallery.title: Scrim snapshots
gallery.description: A peek at recent friendlies and why teams keep coming back. Hover or tap a card to swap the stack.

harju.title: Harju night rally
harju.subtitle: Vs RedFox // 3 rounds
harju.description: Full blackout scrim where both squads agreed on no tanks. We rotated support squads through rooftops and secured both uplinks.

mutaha.title: Mutaha bridge hold
mutaha.subtitle: Joint lobby with SunOps
mutaha.description: Objective was to hold the bridge choke for 12 minutes straight. Engineers cycled deployables while recon fed live marks.

fallujah.title: Fallujah rush hour
fallujah.subtitle: Community mix // best of 2
fallujah.description: Fast-paced city push with mixed squads from EU and NA. We swapped leads mid-round and still squeezed out both caps.

hero.title: Squad Invasion Platform Roadmap
hero.description: Detailed plan for scaling the landing page into a full-featured platform for organizing custom events, managing clans, and tracking statistics.

phases.title: Development Phases
phases.description: Step-by-step platform development plan with feature prioritization

phase0.title: Phase 0: Infrastructure Setup
phase0.description: Database setup, authentication, and basic infrastructure for scaling.

phase1.title: Phase 1: MVP - Basic Platform
phase1.description: Minimum viable product for event organization with authentication and basic management.

phase2.title: Phase 2: v1.0 - Clans and Teams
phase2.description: Adding clan system, team registration, and basic statistics.

phase3.title: Phase 3: v1.5 - Planning and Notes
phase3.description: Tactical planning tools with personal and shared notes.

phase4.title: Phase 4: v2.0 - Leaderboards and Statistics
phase4.description: Competitive elements with rating system, leaderboards, and advanced analytics.

phase5.title: Phase 5: v2.5 - Communication and Notifications
phase5.description: Improved user interaction through notifications and built-in communication.

phase6.title: Phase 6: v3.0 - Advanced Features
phase6.description: Adding matchmaking, advanced analytics, and additional features.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.description: Overall development time estimate and required resources

users.searchDescription: Find users by email, username, or name

create.mapImageAutoLoaded: Map image will be automatically loaded when map is selected

squad.comingSoonDescription: Squad management functionality will be available soon

notes.title: Squad Notes
notes.description: Shared notes and tactical plans for your squad
notes.comingSoonDescription: Notes functionality will be available soon
notes.content: Create and edit notes, tactical plans, and other information for your squad here.
